summary: This is an urgent internal email from the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) requesting approval for an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) to travel to the U.K. from October 12-17, 2020. The purpose is to interview a victim/witness in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, who was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein, as she will only speak in person and her statement is needed to preserve the government's right to use her testimony at trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case for which the AUSA is traveling to interview a victim/witness.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier whose alleged victim is the witness being interviewed in the Maxwell case.

connections.description: Maxwell is the defendant in a case where the witness was a victim of Epstein, implying their alleged association in criminal activity.

events.title: AUSA Travel to U.K. for Witness Interview
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney travels to the United Kingdom to conduct an in-person interview with a victim/witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The SDNY urgently requested approval for an AUSA to travel to the U.K. in October 2020 to interview a victim/witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The witness was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein and would only provide a statement in person.
The interview was necessary to preserve the government's right to use the witness's testimony at Maxwell's trial.
